original: ci ltar yang ni rtogs 'gyur te //

analyzed: de nyid mthong 'dod bdag la ni //
translated: who desires to see reality,

original: rkyen dang bral ba dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom dang / rnam par kun nas mchongs pa dang / khyad par med pa dang / thabs ma yin pa dang / chags pa dang / mngon par lhung ba rnams te /

analyzed: bdag ni mngon par smra ba dang / bdag ni shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nga rgyal lo //

analyzed: gang zhig bdag de rnams nyid 'di yid dang blo dang las rnams so //

original: khyad par med pa ni slar rab tu sad pa dang ma sad pha dag gi rang bzhin med pa rnams kyi khyad par shes pa nyid de de ni khyad par med pa ste zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //

original: ba dag shes par bya'o //

analyzed: bzhi po 'di rtogs nas zhing shes pa sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol te mi zad pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having realized these four, one will attain the state of the exhaustion of suffering and the deathless state.

analyzed: thog mar khyim gyi 'ching ba khong nad sa bon dor nas ni //

analyzed: rtags ni bzung nas thar pa'i bde ba nye bar 'dod pa yi //

original: chog shes dang ni ldan ba bla med go 'phang thob 'dod pa //
analyzed: chog shes dang ni ldan ba bla med go 'phang thob 'dod pa //

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nyer bzung nags nang gnas par dben //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nyer bzung nags nang gnas par dben //

translated: who later, having understood the fear and happiness of one who has gone forth from attachment and non-attachment, who has subdued all the hosts of sense faculties, who has mental concentration,

original: de nas 'dod pa rnams dang / sdang ba la sogs pa rnams las rnam par dben pa rnam par dben pa las skyes pa'i bsam gtan dang po rtog pa dang bcas pa thob pa yin no //

translated: then, detached from sense desires, detached from ill-will, he attains the first dhyāna with initial and sustained thought.

original: des kyang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'dod pa la sdong zhing smod pa'i zhi ba dang ldan pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'dod pa la sdong zhing smod pa'i zhi ba dang ldan pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, he realizes the world of Brahmā, which is peaceful, free from desire, free from ill-will, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa de rnams kyang yid kun nas 'khrugs par byed pa shes nas de dang rnam par bral ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i bdag nyid can bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pa yin no //

translated: Having understood that those discursive thoughts disturb the mind, he attains the second concentration, which has the nature of joy and pleasure that is free from those discursive thoughts.

original: dga' ba des kyang yid 'phrog par gyur pa 'od gsal gyi lha rnams su skye ba yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba des kyang yid 'phrog par gyur pa 'od gsal gyi lha rnams su skye ba yin te /
translated: Through that joy, he is reborn as a god in Ābhāsvara.

original: gang zhig slar dga' ba'i bde ba de las sems 'don par byed pa de ni gsum pa bde ba dang dga' ba dang rnam par bral ba'i bsam gtan thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig slar dga' ba'i bde ba de las sems 'don par byed pa de ni gsum pa bde ba dang dga' ba dang rnam par bral ba'i bsam gtan thob pa yin no //
translated: One who turns his mind away from that joy of the second concentration attains the third concentration, which is free from joy and pleasure.

original: de tsam gyi bde ba la yid nub pa de dge rgyas kyi lha rnams su skye ba so sor thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi bde ba la yid nub pa de dge rgyas kyi lha rnams su skye ba so sor thob pa yin no //
translated: Having entered into that pleasure, he is reborn as a god in Śubhakṛtsna.

original: bde ba de lta bu thob nas gang zhig btang snyoms byed pa de ni bzhi pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par bral ba'i bsam gtan nye bar thob pa yin te /

translated: One who, having attained that pleasure, is indifferent attains the fourth concentration, which is free from pleasure and pain.

original: de ni tshe ring ba nyid kyis kha cig ni grol ba nyid nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshe ring ba nyid kyis kha cig ni grol ba nyid nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: Some are liberated by the longevity of this concentration.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par gcad pa'i phyir dang / sems la bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par gcad pa'i phyir dang / sems la bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free from pleasure and pain, and because they are free from mental activity.

original: bsam gtan 'di'i 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams su thun mong gi 'bras bu mkhas pa rnams smra ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'di'i 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams su thun mong gi 'bras bu mkhas pa rnams smra ba yin te /
translated: The wise say that the gods of the Mahābrahmā group are the common result of this concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas lus can rnams kyi skyon rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas lus can rnams kyi skyon rnams mthong ste /
translated: Having arisen from that concentration, they see the faults of embodied beings.

original: lus rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They realize the wisdom that turns away from the body.

original: bsam gtan de yang spangs nas khyad par 'dod pa gzugs la shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan de yang spangs nas khyad par 'dod pa gzugs la shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Having abandoned that concentration, they desire a special object and become free from attachment to form.

original: lus 'di la sdug bsngal rnams gang zhig yod pa de rnams ni dang por blos kun nas lta bar byed cing sdug cing mthug pa'i yang rdzas rnams la yang @195b nam mkhar lhag pa'i mos pa skyed par byed de /🔽nam mkha' la song ba'i bdag nyid mngon par bsdus nas nam mkha' mtha' yas pa mthong zhing khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir dang bdag nyid la mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid la bsdus te cung zad med ces bya ba ni ci yang med pa zhes bya ba'i🔽'du shes su nye bar song ba lus dang bral ba'i grol ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: lus 'di la sdug bsngal rnams gang zhig yod pa de rnams ni dang por blos kun nas lta bar byed cing sdug cing mthug pa'i yang rdzas rnams la yang @195b nam mkhar lhag pa'i mos pa skyed par byed de / nam mkha' la song ba'i bdag nyid mngon par bsdus nas nam mkha' mtha' yas pa mthong zhing khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir dang bdag nyid la mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid la bsdus te cung zad med ces bya ba ni ci yang med pa zhes bya ba'i 'du shes su nye bar song ba lus dang bral ba'i grol ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The suffering that exists in this body is first seen by the mind.🔽Then, with regard to the thick, substantial things, one generates the idea that they are space.🔽Having concentrated the self that has gone into space, one sees infinite space and realizes the difference.🔽Because one is skilled in the self, one concentrates on the self and thinks, “There is nothing at all.”🔽This is called “approaching the idea of nothing at all” and “liberation from the body.”🔽🔽

analyzed: grol ba ga las 'byung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i bya ba rnams //

analyzed: ji ltar yang chu dang sa rnam par bral bas sa bon ni gang gis kyang rab tu btsugs pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: In any case, since it is devoid of water and earth, the seed is not seen to be planted by anything at all.

analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: las dang mi shes pa dang sred pa dor bas thar pa gang zhig nges pa yin pa de ni bdag po yod ba la de yongs su dor ba dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /

analyzed: de yongs su mdor ba ni thar pa ga la yod /

analyzed: de ltar nga rgyal yongs su dor ba ni bdag yod pa ga la 'gyur /
translated: Thus, if pride is abandoned, how could there be a self?🔽And if there is a self, the continuum of birth is not tenable.

analyzed: nga rgyal yod pa la yang skye ba'i rgyun mi gnas pa nyid yin te zhes bya bar gsungs nas /

analyzed: kun nas stobs chung ba'i lus can byang chub sems dpas chu bo nee r'anydza na la khrus mdzad nas /
